com.kuka.geometry

Class PhysicalObjectUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kuka.geometry.PhysicalObjectUtils

  • public final class PhysicalObjectUtils
extends Object
    Provides utility methods for physical objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static LoadData calculateCombinedLoadData(Frame reference, Collection<? extends SpatialObject> objects)
      Calculates the combined load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all given spatial objects with respect to the given reference frame (only the objects in the collection will be taken into account for the calculation, not the respective child objects).
      static LoadData calculateLoadData(SpatialObject object)
      Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of the spatial object and all of its descendant objects.
      static LoadData calculateLoadDataOnFrame(ObjectFrame reference)
      Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all descendant physical objects attached to the given reference frame and its child frames, excluding the owner of the reference frame.
      static LoadData calculateLoadDataOnFrame(ObjectFrame reference, boolean includeOwner)
      Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all descendant physical objects attached to the given reference frame and its child frames, optionally including, by default excluding the owner of the reference frame.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • calculateLoadDataOnFrame

        public static LoadData calculateLoadDataOnFrame(ObjectFrame reference)
        Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all descendant physical objects attached to the given reference frame and its child frames, excluding the owner of the reference frame.

        The resulting load data is expressed with respect to the given reference frame.

        Parameters:
        reference - the reference frame whose descendant objects together with the descendant objects of its child frames should be part of the calculation. Also the reference frame for the calculated load data.
        Returns:
        the combined load data with respect to the reference frame
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null
        IllegalStateException - if the relation between the involved frames could not be determined
        ThreadInterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during execution. The thread interrupt flag will be set if the thread was interrupted (that is, Thread.isInterrupted() will return true)

      • calculateLoadDataOnFrame

        public static LoadData calculateLoadDataOnFrame(ObjectFrame reference,
                                                boolean includeOwner)
        Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all descendant physical objects attached to the given reference frame and its child frames, optionally including, by default excluding the owner of the reference frame.

        The resulting load data is expressed with respect to the given reference frame.

        Parameters:
        reference - the reference frame whose descendant objects together with the descendant objects of its child frames should be part of the calculation. Also the reference frame for the calculated load data.
        includeOwner - True, if object owning reference frame should be included in calculation, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the combined load data with respect to the reference frame
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null
        IllegalStateException - if the relation between the involved frames could not be determined
        ThreadInterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during execution. The thread interrupt flag will be set if the thread was interrupted (that is, Thread.isInterrupted() will return true)

      • calculateLoadData

        public static LoadData calculateLoadData(SpatialObject object)
        Calculates the load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of the spatial object and all of its descendant objects. Only objects that have load data (i.e. instances of PhysicalObject are taken into account for the calculation.

        The resulting load data is expressed with respect to the object's root frame.

        Parameters:
        object - the spatial object to get the overall load data from.
        Returns:
        the overall load data with respect to the reference frame
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null
        IllegalStateException - if the relation between the involved frames could not be determined
        ThreadInterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during execution. The thread interrupt flag will be set if the thread was interrupted (that is, Thread.isInterrupted() will return true)

      • calculateCombinedLoadData

        public static LoadData calculateCombinedLoadData(Frame reference,
                                                 Collection<? extends SpatialObject> objects)
        Calculates the combined load data (mass, center of mass and inertia) of all given spatial objects with respect to the given reference frame (only the objects in the collection will be taken into account for the calculation, not the respective child objects). The root frames of all objects must have a static connection (directly or indirectly) to the given reference frame.

        Objects without load data (i.e. objects that are not an instance of PhysicalObject or objects where PhysicalObject.getLoadData() returns null) are ignored in the calculation.

        Parameters:
        reference - the reference frame for the calculated load data
        objects - a collection of spatial objects that must have a static connection to the reference frame
        Returns:
        the combined load data with respect to the reference frame
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null, or if there is no connection or an unknown connection type between the reference frame and the root frame of any of the given objects.
        IllegalStateException - if the relation between the involved frames could not be determined
        ThreadInterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during execution. The thread interrupt flag will be set if the thread was interrupted (that is, Thread.isInterrupted() will return true)
